content.question: Which of the following could not be the graph of a particular solution to the logistic differential equation <math alttext="the derivative of y, with respect to t, equals, 0.8 y times, open parenthesis, 1 minus the fraction y over 20, close parenthesis " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>0.8</mn><mi>y</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mrow><mo>âˆ’</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>20</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: The figure presents the graph of a curve in a coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and there are no values indicated. The vertical axis is labeled y, and the values 10, 20, and 30 are indicated. The curve begins on the y axis at 30, and moves downward and to the right, curving upward, until it reaches a point with y value approaching 20 that is about one fourth of the way along the horizontal t axis. From here, the curve moves horizontally to the right until it ends.

The figure presents the graph of a curve in a coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and there are no values indicated. The vertical axis is labeled y, and the values 10, 20, and 30 are indicated. The curve begins on the y axis at approximately 12, and moves upward and to the right, curving downward, until it reaches a point with y value approaching 20 that is about one fourth of the way along the horizontal t axis. From here, the curve moves horizontally to the right until it ends.

The figure presents the graph of a curve in a coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and there are no values indicated. The vertical axis is labeled y, and the values 10, 20, and 30 are indicated. The curve begins on the y axis at approximately 4, and moves upward and to the right, curving downward. As the graph reaches a y value approaching 20, it begins to level off, and moves horizontally to the right until it ends.

The figure presents the graph of a curve in a coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and there are no values indicated. The vertical axis is labeled y, and the values 10, 20, and 30 are indicated. The curve begins on the y axis at approximately 4, and moves upward and to the right. At first, it curves upward, but about one fourth of the way along the horizontal axis, at a y value between 10 and 20, it begins to curve downward. The curve continues upward, and as the graph reaches a y value approaching 20, it begins to level off, and moves horizontally to the right until it ends.

content.answer: The figure presents the graph of a curve in a coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and there are no values indicated. The vertical axis is labeled y, and the values 10, 20, and 30 are indicated. The curve begins on the y axis at approximately 4, and moves upward and to the right, curving downward. As the graph reaches a y value approaching 20, it begins to level off, and moves horizontally to the right until it ends.
